STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 27, 2022
Harrison Gloss
Saginaw Co Youth Prot Council
Po Box 3191
Saginaw, MI 48605
RE: License #: CB730201194
Innerlink Transitional Living Program
1110 Howard Street
Saginaw, MI 48601
Dear Mr. Gloss:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
04/23/2022. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation
Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of
any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is
in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements except
for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has not submitted any acceptable corrective action plans not
related to maltreatment during this licensing period. No corrective action plans
have been required.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
